Statistical Mechanics and Algorithms

I had come across this course titled "Statistical Mechanics: Algorithms and Computations" on Coursera. I can't say that I completed the course successfully, but I do plan to finish the content one day. The course, although supposedly self-contained, also has an optional companion textbook which has some good reviews on Amazon.

This was not my first encounter with algorithms with origins Statistical Mechanics, thanks to the Metropolis-Hastings algorithm. It is a member of the Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) algorithms. The Metropolis-Hastings is named after Nicholas Metropolis and W.K.Hastings, but it does seem to have a controversial history (Wiki link) about its origins.
